div.l: He most serue hym self that hath no swayn
Or ellis he is a fool as clerkys sayne
Oure maunciple I hope wil be ded
So werkys ay the vaynes in his hed
And therfore is I comyn and eke alan
To grynde oure corne ⁊and bring yt ham agan
I pray yow spede vs heyn in that yee may
Yt shal be doon̄ quoth symkyn by my fay
What shal yee doon̄ whils þᵗat it is in hand
By god right by the hopir wil I stand
Quoth Iohan and se how the corn gas In
For þat yetþatyet saugh I neuyr by my fadir kyn
b Aleyn answerd and seid wilt thou swa Transposition of 119-20 corrected by "ba" marks in the margin.
a How that the hoper waggis til and fra
Than wil I be bynethe by my crown
And see how the mele fallys doun̄
In to the tvowgh that shal be my disport The scribe apparently began to write "w" as the second letter of "tvowgh" but stopped in the middle.
For Iohan in faith I may be of your sort
And YAnd Y is als euyl a myllere as is yee
This myllere smylid at here nycetee
And said al this ne is doon but for a wile
Thei wene that no man may hem beguyle
But by my thryfte yit shal I blere þeire eye ·
For al the sleight in here philosophie
The more queynt brekkys þat þei make
The more shal I stele whan I take
In stede of floure yit wil I gyf hem bren
The grettest clerkis be not wysest men
As whilom to the wolf spak the mare
Of al here art ne count I not a tare
Out at the doore he goth fulful pryuely
Whan that he saugh his tyme soothly
He lokith vp and doun̄ til he founde
The clerkis hors there he stood bounde
Behynd the mylle doore vnder a leffesel ·
And to theyr hors he gos fayre and wel
He stripith of the brydel right a non
And whan the hors was louse he to gon
Toward the fen there wilde marys renne
And forth with weehee thurgh thykke ⁊and thenne
This myllere comyth agayn no wurd he said
But doos his note and with clerkis playd
Til that here corne was fayre ⁊and wel yy grounde
And whan the mele was in the sekke y bounde
This Iohan gos out and fyndis his hors away
And gan toto cry harrow and welaway
Oure hors is lost alan for goddis banys
Stert vp on thi feet com out man al at anys
Allas oure warden has his palfray lorn̄
This alan al forgat bothe mele and corn̄
Al was out of his mynd his husbandry
What whilk way is he gane he gan cry
// The doughtyr cam lepyng inward with a ren
She said allas your hors gos to the fen
With wilde maris als fast as he myght go
Vnthank come on his handis þᵗat bond hym so
And he that shuld haue bettyr knyt þe Reyne
Allas quoth Iohan  allan for cristes peyne
Layd doun̄ thi swerd and I wil myn alswa
I is ful wight god wat as any ra ·
By goddis hert he shal not escape vs bathe
Whi ne hadde thou put the hors in the lathe ·
Il hayl alan by god thou is a fon
Thise sely clerkys has ful fast yronne defectus
He half a busshel of thaire floᵘur has take ·
And bad his wyfe go knede yt in a cake ·
He seid I trowe the clerkis were a ferd
Yit can a myllere make a clerkys berd
For al her art now lat hem gon her way
Lo where thei gon ye lat the children play
The gete hym not so lightly by my crown̄
Thise sely clerkis renne vp and doun̄
With keep · keep · stand · standstand · iosa · war the rere
Ga whistle thou and I shal kepe hym heere ·
But shortly til yt was nyght veryvery
Thai ne couth though þei did al þeire mygh
Here capille cacche  he ran away so fast
Til in a diche thei caught hym at þe last
Wery and weet as beest is in the Rayn
Comyth sely Iohn and with hym gothgoth alayn
Allas quoth Iohan þe day that I was born̄
Now are we dryuyn bothe to hething ⁊and scorn
Oure corn is stoln men wil vs foolys calle
Bothe the wardan ⁊and oure felowys alle
And namely the myller welaway
Thus pleyneth Iohan as he gos by the way
Toward the mylle and bayard in his hand
The myller syttyng by the fyre he fand
For yt was nyght and ferther myght þei nought
But for the loue of god thei hym besought
Of herbergh and ease as for here peny
The millere seid agayn yif ther be any
